content: shearwater socks by sandra buzza this is a very basic sock pattern with a beginner friendly textured stitch that gives a subtle blending to the colours of hand dyed yarns to soften the look gauge 34 sts over 4 in pattern or in stockinette sizes there are a total of 4 sizes giving a foot circumference of 6 75 7 25 7 75 and 8 25 or 17 18 5 20 21 cm these measurements are unstretched and should be at least 1 smaller than your actual foot measurements materials 100 gm/300-400m fingering weight sock yarn will be enough for all sizes needle size a 2 25 mm us 1 circular needle long enough for magic loop or dpns if you prefer the instructions are written for magic loop knitting textured stitch this is worked over a multiple of 2 stitches the slipped stitches in this pattern are all made with the yarn in front of your work to create a visible bar over the stitch abbreviated sl1 wyif round 1 *k1 sl1 wyif repeat from * across round round 2 knit round 3 *p1 k1 repeat from * across round round 4 knit instructions cast 60 64 68 72 sts using the german twisted cast on or any other very stretchy cast on join your knitting in the round being careful not to twist the stitches and distribute them so that half the stitches are on each side of the needle ribbing round *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat ribbing round until cuff measures 1 2 5 cm change to the textures stitch pattern and repeat the 4 rounds till the leg measures 5 13 cm or desired length from the cast on ending with round 1 next round in this round knit the first half of the stitches plus one extra stitch so that the heel flap will be worked across an odd number of stitches k 31 33 35 37 if you are using the magic loop method you will knit the first stitch on the second half of the needle and then slide it back over to the first half of the stitches there are now 29 31 33 35 heel stitches that will be worked back and forth heel flap **note that for the heel flap and heel turn every stitch slipped on the right side of the work will be slipped as if to purl with the yarn in back of your work every stitch slipped on the wrong side will be slipped with the yarn in front of your work row 1 s1 k3 *s1 k1 repeat from * to last 5 sts s1 k4 row 2 s1 k3 purl to last 4 sts k3 p1 repeat the last 2 row 14 15 15 16 more times this will give a total of 15 16 16 17 slipped stitches on each side to pick up for the gusset heel turn heel turn row 1 rs slip1 k16 17 18
